messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/8/2003 4:12:24 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

>>>I'm having this problem with my email not quoting right. Sandra pointed
it
out with my first email from 9.0...but I haven't habituated to *fixing* it
for
every response, yet. I apologize fi my emails are hard to read.

But also other AOL people's emails are turning up like mine. Has anyone
found a fix?

Tuck<<<

Nope, I haven't. I just use more spaces and more >>><<< and hope it comes out
OK. Definitely a 9.0 thang.

~Kelly

-pam

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] AOHell
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/8/03 08:23:37 AM Central Daylight Time, Tuckervill@aol.com writes: I m having this problem with my email not quoting right.  Sandra
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/8/03 08:23:37 AM Central Daylight Time,
Tuckervill@... writes:
I'm having this problem with my email not quoting right. Sandra pointed it
out with my first email from 9.0...but I haven't habituated to *fixing* it
for
every response, yet. I apologize fi my emails are hard to read.

But also other AOL people's emails are turning up like mine. Has anyone
found a fix?

Tuck
##########################

I am really hating the new 9.0 AOL. It runs all my post together with what
ever post I am responding to. That is why I keep putting the run of symbols
between the quote I am responding to and my response. I miss posts all the time
too. I hate it! Darin suggested going back to 8.0 or getting 8.0 enhanced. For
about two weeks I had to send any email I had written to the mail waiting to be
sent box first and then sign off and sign back on. Then it would take forever
to send just one. If I tried to send it the normal way, the little hourglass
thing would pop up and never go away and the computer would just freeze. AOL
informed me it was an internal glitch and they would have it fixed soon. Soon
took two weeks. Another thing I have noticed is that it used to be that if
someone had quoted someone else's post there were little marks to note that. Now
there are none. Sometimes by the time I get someone's first post, five other
people have responded to it and I get their responses to a post I haven't even
received yet. Very confusing! OTOH, my sister in PA is having no problems with
hers. But she doesn't belong to any email groups or loops.

~Nancy

He felt that his whole life was some kind of dream and he sometimes wondered
whose it was and whether they were enjoying it.
Douglas Adams


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: AOHell
messages.msgSnippet: I m having this problem with my email not quoting right.  Sandra pointed it out with my first email from 9.0...but I haven t habituated to *fixing* it for
messages.messageBody:
I'm having this problem with my email not quoting right. Sandra pointed it
out with my first email from 9.0...but I haven't habituated to *fixing* it for
every response, yet. I apologize fi my emails are hard to read.

But also other AOL people's emails are turning up like mine. Has anyone
found a fix?

Tuck


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
